## Basics of using Git

Git is a disturbuted version control system (VCS) that is veryyy popular.

There are 4 core steps to using Git:

1.  Initiate a git repository In RStudio we just click a little radio button on project creation At the command line we type: `git init`

2.  Do your normal work Add/modify files etc

3.  Add your important files to the "stage" In RStudio we clikc the "staged" radio button `git add yourfilename`

4.  Commit your staged files to the repository In RStudio you just hit the "Commit" button and add a message `git commit -m "your message`

You can check your project "history" and status `git status` or `git log`

5. Git Push to sync changes TO GitHub
The up arrow in RStudio 
`git push`

6. Git Pull to sync FROM GitHub
The down arrow in RStudio 
`git pull`

You can check your project "history" and statius 
`git status`
